title: MySQL DISTINCT
subject: MySQL
theory:
## Removing Duplicates
The `SELECT DISTINCT` statement is used to return only distinct (different) values.
Inside a table, a column often contains many duplicate values; sometimes you only want to list the different (distinct) values.
syntax: SELECT DISTINCT column1, column2 FROM table_name;

practice_problems.problem: Select all unique job titles from employees.

exam_notes: DISTINCT applies to the combination of all selected columns.
Can be slow on large datasets without indexes.
summary: DISTINCT filters out duplicate rows in the result set, giving you a list of unique values.
